privacy_policy_content_text113: STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe will only be active during the pandemic period [COVID-19] and may be deactivated in accordance with the decision of the GIS. After stopping the use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, all Personal Data will be deleted along with the Application.
privacy_policy_content_text114: The User's Personal Data in the form of an anonymous UID address may be transferred outside the European Economic Area as regards the use of the service provided by Cloudflare in order to prevent DDOS attacks and ensure the highest standards of Users' security. Such transfer will also take place only in an exceptional situation, in particular when the User uses the Application outside the European Economic Area on basis of standard contractual clauses.
privacy_policy_content_text115: No decisions as part of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe are made in an automated manner within the meaning of Article 22 of the GDPR. This means that the fact of using the Application does not result in issuing any decisions in relation to the User that could have a legal effect or similarly significantly affect the User.
privacy_policy_content_text117: STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe enables the User to exercise the right to delete Personal Data at any time:
privacy_policy_content_text118: In order to delete Personal Data from the Triage Module, the Health Diary Module and other Personal Data entered by the User, select on the main screen of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe the following: More, then My Data, then Manage Data, then Erase Data. After the User's confirmation, all data entered by the User will be irretrievably deleted.
privacy_policy_content_text119: In order to delete Personal Data from the Analytical Module, the User has to:
privacy_policy_content_text120: for devices with iOS version 13.5 or 13.6, select the following: System Settings > Privacy > Health > [COVID-19] Exposure Logging > Delete Exposure Log;
privacy_policy_content_text131: for devices with Android system, select the following: Settings > Google > Notifications about the risk of exposure to [COVID-19] > Delete random identifiers;[BR] after the User's confirmation, all data related to the Analytical Module will be irretrievably deleted.
privacy_policy_content_text133: For any questions and requests related to Users' rights, please contact us at: [EMAIL]protego@mc.gov.pl[/EMAIL]
privacy_policy_content_text134: The User has the right to lodge a complaint with the President of the Personal Data Protection Office if they consider that the Processing of their Personal Data violates the provisions of the GDPR or generally applicable provisions. The complaint can be sent in writing to the following address: Prezes Urzędu Ochrony Danych Osobowych, ul. Stawki 2, 00-193 Warszawa or electronically via the ePUAP portal.
privacy_policy_content_text136: STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe may contain links to other websites. Such websites operate independently of GIS and are not supervised by it in any way. These websites sites may have their own privacy policies, which we recommend that the User should familiarise with.
privacy_policy_content_text137: GIS reserves the right to amend the Privacy Policy by publishing a new Privacy Policy on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe website.
privacy_policy_content_text139: [B]STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe or Application[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application, which includes the Analytical Module, the Triage Module and the Health Diary Module, and also supports the prophylaxis and prevention of infection, transmits important information related to the pandemic [COVID-19]  and reminds about safe behaviours and daily hygiene habits.
privacy_policy_content_text14: The Key sent from your Device to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server will not contain any data enabling identification or information about the Devices you have had contact with. It is up to you to decide whether you want to mark your Device as a Device of a Person Tested Positive, which will initiate the sending of an anonymous Key to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, and then to other Application Users. Each Application, after receiving the Key, performs an automatic analysis of meetings by appropriate comparison of the received Key with the history of meetings of Devices with the installed Application from the last 14 days. The analysis is performed independently on the Device of each User, it takes into account in particular the Users' distance (signal strength) and the time of staying in the vicinity of an infected person and as a result the status of the current risk group may be changed.
privacy_policy_content_text140: [B]Analytical Module[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that enables saving, creating history and analysing the meeting of the User's Device with other Application Users' Devices. The Analytical Module is based on the Privacy-Preserving Contact Tracing API developed and made available by Google and Apple. The information generated by the Analytical Module along with the results of its work is stored locally on the Device for 14 days. Google and Apple in their documentation, which can be found here: [URL]exposurenotifications|https://www.google.com/covid19/exposurenotifications/[/URL] and [URL]exposurenotification|https://developer.apple.com/documentation/exposurenotification[/URL] ensure that they apply the highest security standards to protect Users' privacy.
privacy_policy_content_text141: The controller of User Data is the Chief Sanitary Inspector based in Warsaw, at ul. Targowa 65, 03–729 Warsaw.
privacy_policy_content_text142: The Data Controller has appointed a data protection officer. You can contact the data protection officer in all matters relating to the processing of personal data by the Data Controller and the exercise of rights related to the processing of such data. The Data Protection Officer is Renata Wągrodzka with whom you can contact via the e-mail address: [EMAIL]iod@gis.gov.pl[/EMAIL]
privacy_policy_content_text146: [B]Person Tested Positive[/B] - it is understood as a natural person with full legal capacity, who has been tested positive for the [COVID-19]. The Person Tested Positive does not have to be a User.
privacy_policy_content_text148: [B]Processing[/B] - it is understood as an operation or a set of operations, which are performed on personal data or sets of personal data in an automated or non-automated manner, such as collecting, recording, organizing, structuring, storing, adapting or modifying, downloading, browsing, using, disclosing through sending, distributing or sharing in any other way, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction.
privacy_policy_content_text150_3: Personal Data is processed solely for the purpose of supporting the public in preventing the spread of the pandemic [COVID-19]: acting in the broadly understood public interest, the controller, by distributing and ensuring the operability of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application, supports the rapid exchange of information between natural persons within a specific community, acting for the prevention of public health and counteracting the spread of SARS CoV-2 virus and disease [COVID-19], through the exchange of anonymised information on infected persons and software enabling the analysis of meetings and contacts, as well as through algorithms enabling the assessment of the risk of infection.
privacy_policy_content_text151_4: Personal Data regarding the User's health is also processed on the basis of [B]Article 9, paragraph 2, letter i of the GDPR[/B] in connection with the public task of preventing, counteracting and combating [COVID-19] resulting from Article 1, 2, 3, 6 and 8a paragraph 1, 4 and 5 of the Act of 14 March 1985 on the State Sanitary Inspection (Journal of Laws of 2019, item 59), because processing is necessary for reasons related to the public interest in the field of public health, such as protection against serious cross-border health threats under the law of the Member State.
privacy_policy_content_text152: it maintains the confidentiality of Personal Data;
privacy_policy_content_text153: Providing Personal Data referred to in paragraph 5 point3 of this section is voluntary, but may condition the use of all the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionalities.
privacy_policy_content_text154: The processed Personal Data are not made available to the Recipients of Personal Data in a form that would allow the identification of the data subject.
privacy_policy_content_text155: The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR
privacy_policy_content_text157: the right to access Personal Data based on Article 15 of the GDPR;
privacy_policy_content_text158: the right to rectify Personal Data based on Article 16 of the GDPR;
privacy_policy_content_text159: the right to delete Personal Data based on Article 17 of the GDPR;
privacy_policy_content_text16: This Privacy Policy sets out the rules for the collection, processing and protection of Users' Personal Data in connection with the use of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application. Neither the Chief Sanitary Inspector (GIS) nor the Ministry of Digital Affairs (MC) identifies STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users.
privacy_policy_content_text160: the right to request the Controller to limit the Processing of Personal Data based on Article 18 of the GDPR, subject to the cases referred to in Article 18 paragraph 2 of the GDPR;
privacy_policy_content_text161: the right to object to the Processing of Personal Data based on Article 21 of the GDPR.
privacy_policy_content_text162: Exercising the rights referred to in paragraph 1 is possible by using the appropriate STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionalities.
privacy_policy_content_text163: for Devices with iOS version 14, select the following: System Settings> Exposure Notifications -> Delete Exposure Log;
privacy_policy_content_text164: The User has the right to withdraw consent to the operation of the Analytical Module at any time, but the withdrawal of consent will not affect the lawfulness of the actions performed prior to its withdrawal. To withdraw consent related to the Analytical Module:
privacy_policy_content_text165: for Devices with iOS version 13.5 or 13.6, select the following: System Settings> Privacy> Health> COVID-19 Exposure Logging -> Disable Exposure Logging;
privacy_policy_content_text166: for Devices with iOS version 14, select System Settings > Exposure Notifications > Disable Exposure Logging;
privacy_policy_content_text168: for Devices with Android system, select the following: Settings -> Google -> Notifications about the risk of exposure to COVID-19 -> Disable Notifications about the risk of exposure;[BR] after the User's confirmation, the Analytical Module will cease to operate.
privacy_policy_content_text169: The User has the right to withdraw the consent expressed pursuant to Article 173 paragraph 1 of the Telecommunications Law at any time, but the withdrawal of consent will not affect the lawfulness of actions performed before its withdrawal. To withdraw consent, the User has to remove STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from the Device.
privacy_policy_content_text17: By downloading STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from the Play Store or the AppStore and installing it, the User gives the consent referred to in Article 173 paragraph 1 point 2 of the Telecommunications Law; the Terms & Conditions and the Privacy Policy constitute the information referred to in Article 173 paragraph 1 point1 of the Telecommunications Law.
privacy_policy_content_text170: When the SARS-CoV-2 virus pandemic or the pandemic threat ends, the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application will be deactivated.
privacy_policy_content_text171: [B]Current restrictions in poviats[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows you to display in the Application information about areas (poviats) covered by special safety rules introduced due to the pandemic [COVID-19] based on the relevant and current ordinance on the establishment of certain restrictions, prohibitions and limitations in connection with the state of epidemic as well as the amending regulations;
privacy_policy_content_text177: [B]Test PIN code[/B] - it is understood as a randomly generated alphanumeric password active for half an hour from the moment of generation, which is provided to the User by the Contact Centre consultant. The Test PIN code is provided to the User who has a high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] generated by the Analytical Module and high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] confirmed by the Triage Module;
privacy_policy_content_text179: [B]PUSH notification[/B] it is understood as a text message sent by the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, which will be displayed on the screen of the User's Device, regardless of whether the Application is turned on or not. The content of PUSH notifications will be directly related to the development of the SARS-CoV-2 virus pandemic or the Application itself and will be determined each time by the Chief Sanitary Inspector (GIS) or the Ministry of Digital Affairs (MC).
privacy_policy_content_text18: This document is prepared on the basis of the provisions of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of Personal Data and on the free movement of such data and the repeal of Directive 95/46/EC (General Regulation on Data Protection), the Act of 10 May 2018 on the protection of Personal Data (Journal of Laws of 2018, item 1000) and other generally applicable provisions.
privacy_policy_content_text180: Information disclosed indirectly by the User to the Chief Sanitary Inspector in connection with the verification of the correctness of the Test PIN Code:
privacy_policy_content_text182: status of high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] generated by the Analytical Module;
privacy_policy_content_text184: status of a person with high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] generated by the Triage Module;
privacy_policy_content_text185: The data referred to in §3 para. 6 point6, related to the verification of the Test PIN Code are not disclosed to the Chief Sanitary Inspector directly, but only Users who have a double high-risk status indicated by both the Triage Module and the Analytical Module may verify the correctness of the Test PIN Code.
privacy_policy_content_text187: The User has the right to withdraw consent to being sent PUSH Notifications at any time, but the withdrawal of consent will not affect the lawfulness of actions performed prior to its withdrawal. Withdrawal of consent to being sent PUSH notifications doesn't affect notifications about high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] generated by the Application's Analytical Module. In order to withdraw consent to being sent PUSH notifications:
privacy_policy_content_text188: for devices with iOS, select the following: Settings -> ProteGO Safe Notifications -> Disable Notifications
privacy_policy_content_text189: for Devices with Android system, select the following: Settings -> Applications -> Manage applications -> ProteGO Safe -> Disable Notifications; after the User's approval of the decision, PUSH notifications will no longer be sent.
privacy_policy_content_text19: If you have general questions regarding privacy, as well as questions regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:  [EMAIL]protego@mc.gov.pl[/EMAIL] or [EMAIL]iod@gis.gov.pl[/EMAIL].
privacy_policy_content_text190: In the event of consent to Interoperability, the User should read the content of Appendix 1 to this Policy, which defines the rights and obligations of the Joint Controllers and Users in connection with this feature. Annex 1 constitutes Annex 2 to the Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2020/1023 of 15 July 2020 amending Implementing Decision (EU) 2019/1765 regarding cross-border data exchange between national mobile contact tracing and alerting applications in connection with fighting the pandemic [COVID-19].
privacy_policy_content_text193: [B]Joint Controllers[/B] - it is understood as health authorities responsible for administering applications similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, which use the Federation Gate. Details of the cooperation between the Joint Controllers are set out in Annex 1 in accordance with Annex 2 to the Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2020/1023 of 15 July 2020 amending Implementing Decision (EU) 2019/1765 regarding cross-border data exchange between national mobile contact tracing and alerting applications in connection with fighting the [COVID-19] pandemic. The list of Joint Controllers, along with information about their processing of Personal Data of the User who has consented to Interoperability is available here: [URL]https://ec.europa.eu/|https://ec.europa.eu/health/ehealth/covid-19_en[/URL]
privacy_policy_content_text194: [B]Federation Gate[/B] - it is understood as a network gateway operated by the European Commission with the use of a secure IT tool, which is used to receive, store and share a minimum set of Personal Data between internal servers of European Union Member States in order to ensure the interoperability of national mobile applications used to identify infectious contacts and share alerts. Federation Gateway enables Interoperability. Thanks to the Federation Gate, it is possible to send and receive Keys between the User and users of other mobile applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. Keys are shipped through the Federation Gateway, their retention period is 14 days;
privacy_policy_content_text197: [B]Interoperability or Warning in Europe[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows the exchange of Keys between the User and users of other mobile applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, which are supported by other Member States of the European Union and cooperate within the Federation Gate. Thanks to Interoperability, Users can receive information about potential exposure to infection in connection with potential contact with users of other mobile applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe;
privacy_policy_content_text198: Data exchanged and processed through the Federation Gate as part of Interoperability includes the following information:
privacy_policy_content_text199: Keys provided by STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe and other applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, within the period up to 14 days preceding the date of sending the Keys;
privacy_policy_content_text200: log data related to Keys in accordance with the technical specification protocol used in the country of origin of the Keys;
privacy_policy_content_text202: countries selected by the User and the country of origin of the Keys.
privacy_policy_content_text203: STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe allows you to send and receive Keys between STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users and users of applications similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, which use the Federation Gate. Interoperability (Warning in Europe) is voluntary and its use is based on the User's consent expressed pursuant to Article 9 paragraph 1 letter a of the GDPR. Interoperability is provided through the Federation Gate. In order to use Interoperability effectively, the appropriate consent must be given in the Application. The consent given by the User applies to sending and receiving Keys to all mobile applications similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. The consent may be withdrawn at any time, without affecting the sent and received Keys that were sent or received before the consent was withdrawn. After giving consent, the Keys are sent to applications similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. The history of encountering devices on which an application similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is installed will be stored in the Federation Gate for 14 days.
privacy_policy_content_text204: to the extent specified in §3 paragraph 4 point 6 may be the Joint Controllers and the European Commission acting as processor;
privacy_policy_content_text205: Annex 1 - Provisions regarding Joint Administration. Annex 2 to the Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2020/1023 of 15 July 2020 amending Implementing Decision (EU) 2019/1765 regarding cross-border data exchange between national mobile contact tracing and alerting applications in connection with fighting the [COVID-19] pandemic.
privacy_policy_content_text206: Provisions regarding Joint Administration. Annex 2 to the Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2020/1023 of 15 July 2020 amending Implementing Decision (EU) 2019/1765 regarding cross-border data exchange between national mobile contact tracing and alerting applications in connection with fighting the [COVID-19] pandemic.
privacy_policy_content_text207: [B]Responsibilities of the participating Member States as Joint Controllers for the Federation Gate for cross-border processing between mobile applications used to infectious contact tracing and alerting applications[/B]
privacy_policy_content_text212: Joint Controllers process personal data through the federation gateway in accordance with the technical specifications set out by the e-zdrowie network. [URL](1)|https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/PL/TXT/HTML/?uri=CELEX:32020D1023&from=EN#ntr1-LI2020227PL.01000602-E0001[/URL]
privacy_policy_content_text213: Each controller is responsible for the processing of personal data through the federal gateway in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation and Directive 2002/58/EC.
privacy_policy_content_text214: Each controller shall establish a point of contact with a functional mailbox that will be used for communication between the joint controllers and between the joint controllers and the processor.
privacy_policy_content_text215: Temporary subgroup set up by the e-zdrowie network in accordance with Article 5 paragraph 4 is designed to analyse any issues arising from the interoperability of national mobile applications used to identify infectious contacts and share alerts, with joint administration of the related processing of personal data, and to facilitate the issue of coordinated instructions to the Commission as processor. Within the temporary subgroup, controllers may carry out work aimed at, inter alia, developing a common approach to data storage on their national internal servers, taking into account the data retention period defined within the federation gateway.
privacy_policy_content_text216: Instructions to the processor are sent by the contact point of any of the joint controllers in agreement with the other joint controllers in the subgroup mentioned above.
privacy_policy_content_text217: Only persons authorised by designated national or official bodies may have access to your personal data, which is transmitted through the federal gateway.
privacy_policy_content_text218: Any designated national body or official body shall cease to be a Joint Controller from the date of withdrawal from its participation in the federal gateway. However, it remains responsible for any processing through the federal gateway that took place before such withdrawal.
privacy_policy_content_text220: Responsibilities and roles in examining the requests of data subjects and informing them
privacy_policy_content_text221: Each Joint Controller shall provide the users of its national mobile application used to establish infectious contacts and share alerts ("data subjects") with information on the processing of their personal data through the federal gateway for the purposes of cross-border interoperability of national mobile application used to establish infectious contacts and share alerts in accordance with Article 13 and 14 of the General Data Protection Regulation.
privacy_policy_content_text222: Each Joint Controller acts as a contact point for users of its national mobile application used to establish infectious contacts and share alerts and considers requests from these users or their representatives related to the exercise of data subjects' rights, in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation. Each controller shall designate a dedicated point of contact for handling requests received from data subjects. If the Joint Controller receives from the data subject an application which doesn't fall within the scope of their responsibility, they shall immediately forward it to the responsible Joint Controller. When requested, Joint Controllers shall assist each other in examining the requests of data subjects and shall reply to each other without undue delay and not later than within 15 days of receiving the request for assistance.
privacy_policy_content_text223: Each Joint Controller provides data subjects with access to the content of this Annex, including the arrangements set out in points 1 and 2.
privacy_policy_content_text225: Management of cyber incidents, including personal data breaches
privacy_policy_content_text226: Joint Controllers assist each other in identifying cyber incidents and in responding to cyber incidents, including in the case of personal data breaches, in connection with processing through the federation gateway.
privacy_policy_content_text227: Joint Controllers shall, in particular, notify each other on such matters as:
privacy_policy_content_text228: any potential or actual risk to the availability, confidentiality, or integrity of personal data processed through the federation gateway;
privacy_policy_content_text229: any cyber incidents related to a processing operation through the federation gateway;
privacy_policy_content_text23: GIS ensures that it makes every effort to make the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application ensure the highest standard of Users' privacy protection, and in particular ensures that it has taken all legal and technologically possible measures aimed at securing Users' privacy.
privacy_policy_content_text230: any breach of personal data protection, the likely consequences of the breach of personal data protection and the assessment of the risk of violation of the rights and freedoms of natural persons, as well as all measures implemented to counteract the breach of personal data protection and mitigate the risk of violation of the rights and freedoms of natural persons;
privacy_policy_content_text231: any breach of technical or organizational safeguards relating to processing operations through the Federation Gateway.
privacy_policy_content_text232: Joint Controllers notify the Commission, the competent supervisory authorities and, if required, the data subjects of any personal data breaches relating to processing operations through the federal gateway, in accordance with Article 33 and 34 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 or after receiving notification from the Commission.
privacy_policy_content_text235: If, in order to fulfil the obligations set out in Article 35 and 36 of the General Data Protection Regulation, the Joint Controller needs information from another controller, they send a special request to the address of the functional mailbox, referred to in Section 1 subsection 1 point 3. The Joint Controller who received such a request shall make every effort to provide the needed information.
privacy_policy_content_text24: GIS declares that it uses technical and organisational measures to ensure the protection of Users' privacy, which are appropriate to the threats and categories of Personal Data protected, in particular, it uses encryption and protects Personal Data against disclosure to unauthorised persons, removal by an unauthorised person, processing in violation of the law as well as alteration, loss, damage or destruction.
privacy_policy_content_text28: [B]MC[/B] - it is understood as the Minister of Digital Affairs based in Warsaw, at Aleje Ujazdowskie 1/3, 00-583 Warsaw. Based on an agreement concluded with GIS, MC supports GIS in the development and maintenance of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe.
privacy_policy_content_text3: We have prepared this document to inform you how we process data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, as well as what rights you are entitled to. Below you will find key information related to data processing occurring as part of our Application.[BR]We have designed STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in accordance with the Privacy by Default and Privacy by Design principles. This means that we apply the protection of your privacy by default and we have tried to limit the processing of information about you already at the stage of designing and creating the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application. We try not to obtain from you the information that would enable your identification (i.e. personal data), as we believe that effective pandemic prevention [COVID-19] does not require the processing of personal data that identify the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users.
privacy_policy_content_text30: [B]GIS[/B] - it is understood as the Chief Sanitary Inspector based in Warsaw, at ul. Targowa 65, 03–729 Warsaw. GIS is the controller of personal data within the meaning of the GDPR in relation to the personal data of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users. GIS independently determines the purposes and methods of processing Personal Data within STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe.
privacy_policy_content_text31: [B]Personal Data[/B] - it is understood as any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person within the meaning of Article 4 point 1 of the GDPR. The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR, as the purpose of processing does not require identification, therefore STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users are not identified.
privacy_policy_content_text36: [B]Terms & Conditions[/B] - it is understood as the document that specifies the terms of use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, as well as the rights and obligations of GIS, MC and Users.
privacy_policy_content_text43: [B]Triage Module[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows the User to perform a self-assessment of the risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19], based on the WHO questionnaire. Personal Data entered into the Triage Module are stored locally on the User's Device.
privacy_policy_content_text46: [B]Key[/B] - it is understood as a randomly generated, periodic and alphanumeric string of characters sent to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, which contains  encrypted Personal Data, initiating the process of analysis of exposure to infection [COVID-19] as part of the Analytical Module. The Key is transferred to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server after the Person Tested Positive enters the PIN Code into the Application.
privacy_policy_content_text48: [B]STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server[/B] - it is understood as the cloud infrastructure maintained by the National Cloud Operator, used to transmit the Diagnostic Key to Users' Devices. Diagnostic Keys are stored on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server in an encrypted form for 14 (fourteen) days.
privacy_policy_content_text49: [B]Contact Centre[/B] - it is understood as the unit providing the test result by phone [COVID-19], transmitting the PIN Code to the Application Users and providing information related to [COVID-19].
privacy_policy_content_text53: [B]Health Diary Module[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe notepad-like functionality, enabling the User to record information about their health. Personal Data entered into the Health Diary Module are stored locally on the User's Device.
privacy_policy_content_text55: [B]GDPR[/B] - it is understood as the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation).
privacy_policy_content_text57: [B]Device[/B] - it is understood as an electronic device through which the User gains access to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe (tablet, smartphone, etc.) with an active Bluetooth module, Android 5.0 or higher with access to the Google Play store or with an iOS system in a version not lower than 13.5 with access to the AppStore. The Analytical Module will work only on Devices with Android 6.0 supporting BLE technology or higher, or with an iOS version 13.5 or newer.
privacy_policy_content_text59: [B]User[/B] - it is understood as a person with full legal capacity who, after accepting the Terms & Conditions and the Privacy Policy, uses STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe;
privacy_policy_content_text6: The information processed by STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe does not allow your identification.
privacy_policy_content_text60: [B]WHO[/B] - it is understood as the World Health Organization;
privacy_policy_content_text62: The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR, as the purpose of processing does not require User identification. When designing the STOP COVID-ProteGO Safe technical security measures, GIS and MC exercised due diligence to prevent identification of Users. However, due to the fact that the User's Personal Data is processed locally as part of the Application, despite the lack of access to it by GIS as the data controller, the Regulation still applies.
privacy_policy_content_text67_3: Personal Data is processed on the basis of [B]Article 6, paragraph 1, letter e, of the GDPR[/B] in connection with a task carried out in the public interest consisting in preventing, counteracting and combating [COVID-19] resulting from Article 1, 2, 3, 6 and 8a paragraph 1, 4 and 5 of the Act of 14 March 1985 on the State Sanitary Inspection (Journal of Laws of 2019, item 59).
privacy_policy_content_text68: STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe processes Personal Data that does not require identification as provided for in Article 11 of the GDPR. Neither GIS nor MC are able to identify the data subject (User). GIS adheres to the following Personal Data Processing principles:
privacy_policy_content_text69: it implements appropriate technical and organizational measures so that the processing of data about the Application Users takes place in an anonymous manner without their identification in accordance with the provisions on Personal Data protection and to be able to demonstrate it;
privacy_policy_content_text7: We will not have access to personal data that you enter into the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application. We will not take active steps to identify you. We will also not analyse how you use STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe.
privacy_policy_content_text70: it supervises the security of Personal Data throughout the entire period of their possession in a manner ensuring, in particular, protection against unauthorised access, damage, destruction or loss;
privacy_policy_content_text71: it keeps confidential information about the User through the use of encryption;
privacy_policy_content_text72: it provides data subjects with the possibility to make use of their rights under the law.
privacy_policy_content_text73: GIS may process the following Personal Data:
privacy_policy_content_text74: Data related to the use of the server that provides messages to the Users:
privacy_policy_content_text76: [B]UID[/B] – random designation of the User that prevents identification,
privacy_policy_content_text77: Average time of using the Application by Users (statistical data that cannot be linked to individual Users).
privacy_policy_content_text78: Statistical data from application stores, i.e. GooglePlay Store and Apple AppStore, which cannot be associated with individual Users (statistical data):
privacy_policy_content_text79: Information about the installation, last use and removal of the Application;
privacy_policy_content_text8: Information entered into STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe related to the Triage (self-assessment of the risk of infection with COVID-19 - Triage Module) is analysed within STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe without leaving your device.
privacy_policy_content_text80: Location where the User was while installing the Application (city or country specification);
privacy_policy_content_text82: Data stored only locally on Devices, regardless of the Device's operating system. The following data are not transferred outside the User's Device, in particular they are not processed by GIS or MC:
privacy_policy_content_text84: History of entries in the Health Diary,
privacy_policy_content_text85: History of entries in the Triage Module,
privacy_policy_content_text86: Temporary_exposure_keys_upload_status - information whether the transfer of information as part of the Analytical Module was successful or not,
privacy_policy_content_text87: information about whether the Application is launched for the first time,
privacy_policy_content_text89: information whether the User has given their consent to push notifications in the Application,
privacy_policy_content_text9: The functionality of analysing exposure to [COVID-19] infection as a result of contact with other Application Users (Analytical Module) is voluntary. You have the option of analysing the potential exposure [COVID-19] using Bluetooth technology for this purpose. If you decide to use this functionality, your Device will analyse the environment in which you are located in search of other Devices on which the Application is installed. If you encounter another Device on which the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application is installed, information about this meeting will be saved in both Applications. Information about the meeting of two Devices with the Application installed remains on both of these Devices for no longer than 14 days, after which it will be deleted.
privacy_policy_content_text90: information on whether the User has granted the Application an authorisation necessary for the operation of the Analytical Module,
privacy_policy_content_text91: information on whether the device's Bluetooth module is turned on,
privacy_policy_content_text92: Information about the status, activation and operation of the Analytical Module,
privacy_policy_content_text93: Information about the Application status (whether it is running in the foreground or in the background),
privacy_policy_content_text95: history of the Analytical Module analysis results from the last 14 days,
privacy_policy_content_text96: period of contact of Users' Devices, values in the range of 5-30 minutes,
privacy_policy_content_text97: date of contact of the Users' Devices.
privacy_policy_content_text98: Data transferred to other Devices via the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server:
privacy_policy_text2: Together we want to prevent Coronavirus. But your privacy is equally important to us. We designed the application so that all the information you provide to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe prevents your identification. Therefore, you don't need to register an account, we don't ask you for an e-mail address, or linking the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with a social media account.
privacy_policy_text3: If we shall plan any changes, we will inform you about it. You will be able to use most of the new features on an opt-in basis. This means that you can voluntarily use the new functionality or not use it. Details on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application can be found in the Terms & Conditions, and information on the processing of your data can be found in the Privacy Policy.
privacy_policy_text4: You can read the details below:
rating_app_modal_text_2: Your answer will help us improve the app and counter the pandemic more effectively
rating_app_modal_text_4: If you want to have an active impact on the development of the app, [B]please give us your opinion.[/B]
recommendation_more_information_text2: Up-to-date information on the epidemic situation, as well as other advice and tips can be found at [URL]www.gov.pl/koronawirus|https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus[/URL]
recommendation_more_information_text3: Test results are for informational and educational purposes only. Don't treat them as a medical consultation or diagnosis.
recommendations_text_1: Recommendations for you:[BR]Medium risk of infection
recommendations_text_11: • Under no circumstances leave your home. You're not allowed to go out to do shopping, walk the dog, or see a doctor.[BR]• If you have pets with you, give them to your relatives or friends for the duration of the quarantine. If you are unable to do so, contact the commune for help by phone.[BR]• Don't meet with other people or invite people to your place. If you live with your family, they are also quarantined.[BR]• Monitor your body temperature at least twice a day.[BR]• Provide information about your health condition to the employees of the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station who call you.[BR]• Cooperate with policemen who will check whether you comply with the quarantine.
recommendations_text_13: • Wash your hands frequently. Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum 60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with [URL]the hand washing instructions|https://gis.gov.pl/zdrowie/zasady-prawidlowego-mycia-rak/[/URL] on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate.[BR]• Cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze. Cough or sneeze in disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend. Throw the handkerchief in the trash as soon as possible and wash your hands thoroughly.[BR]• Keep a safe distance from others. Avoid close (less than 2 meters) contact with other people.[BR]• Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth, as you can get infected this way. Viruses can persist for hours or days on objects contaminated with secretions such as saliva. According to current knowledge, the coronavirus can survive for up to 3 hours in the air, up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to 72 hours on stainless steel or plastic.[BR]• Use separate utensils and a separate bathroom If you are unable to do so, disinfect the bathroom or toilet after each use with available cleaning agents.[BR]• Air your apartment several times a day.[BR]• Disinfect surfaces. Often disinfect surfaces such as countertops, door handles or phone screens. Clean the devices you use after using them.
recommendations_text_14: Monitor your health condition. If it is alarming or worsening - react.
recommendations_text_15: Immediately notify the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station by phone and report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious department. If your health suddenly worsens and you develop symptoms such as:[BR]• fever above 38° C [BR]• cough [BR]• shortness of breath and breathing difficulties[BR][BR] [URL]Find the number of the nearest station|https://pacjent.gov.pl/podejrzewasz-ze-masz-koronawirusa#znajdz-stacje-sanitarno-epidemiologiczna[/URL] [URL]Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department|https://pacjent.gov.pl/podejrzewasz-ze-masz-koronawirusa#szpitale-z-oddzialami-zakaznymi[/URL][BR]When you go to the infectious disease hospital, wear a mask and always cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze.[BR]Don't use public transport to get to the hospital. If you don't have your own transport, the sanitary and epidemiological station may send an ambulance for you.[BR][BR]When you're in a life or health emergency (such as shortness of breath), call an ambulance by dialling the emergency number [PHONE]999[/PHONE] or [PHONE]112[/PHONE]. Be sure to mention that it may be about a patient with coronavirus.
recommendations_text_16: Don't be afraid to ask for help
recommendations_text_17: You won't be left alone during the quarantine. There are places where you can get the necessary information and additional help, such as material assistance and help with shopping:[BR]• Social welfare centre Call the social welfare centre in your place of residence. An employee of the centre will help you by phone.[BR]• Police - Police officers will check whether you're at home. They pay special attention to lonely, elderly and disabled people. They will provide information about such persons to the social welfare centre.[BR]• Commune – if you are unable to provide yourself with a hot meal or food products and you cannot count on help from your family, the commune will help you. Meals and food products will be provided by designated persons in cooperation with volunteers.[BR]• Psychologist – If you need a psychologist's help, call the social welfare centre in your commune or the poviat family support centre in your poviat.
recommendations_text_18: Recommendations for you:[BR][COLOR]High risk of infection|{{color}}[/COLOR]
recommendations_text_19: [B]Please immediately call the Contact Centre of the State Sanitary Inspection:[/B]
recommendations_text_2: Below you will find the most important information on what to do in this situation. Please familiarise yourself with them. Take care of yourself and others!
recommendations_text_20: If you develop symptoms such as: fever, cough or shortness of breath, call your doctor or use the free teleconsultation provided by a healthcare professional.
recommendations_text_22: [B]Your condition is severe?[/B][BR][B]Don't wait. Call the emergency number 112 or 999 and notify that you may have coronavirus.[/B]
recommendations_text_23: If you feel your medical condition is serious and your symptoms are worsening, [B]contact your primary care physician or go to the nearest hospital emergency department[/B] (call in advance if possible) or [B]call an emergency number.[/B]
recommendations_text_24: Recommendations for you:[BR][COLOR]High risk of infection|{{color}}[/COLOR]
recommendations_text_26: [B]Immediately notify the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station by phone[/B] and report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious department. [B]Avoid contact with other people.[/B]
recommendations_text_27: Immediately notify the district sanitary and epidemiological station by phone or go to an infectious diseases department
recommendations_text_28: [URL]Find the number of the nearest station.|https://pacjent.gov.pl/podejrzewasz-ze-masz-koronawirusa#znajdz-stacje-sanitarno-epidemiologiczna[/URL] [URL]Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department.|https://pacjent.gov.pl/podejrzewasz-ze-masz-koronawirusa#szpitale-z-oddzialami-zakaznymi[/URL] Before appearing in the department, consult the hospital by phone or, if possible, contact your primary care physician. The list of primary health care facilities providing teleconsultation in your area is available [URL]on the website of the National Health Fund (NFZ)|https://bit.ly/teleporady-lista[/URL]
recommendations_text_29: Report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious diseases department
recommendations_text_30: When going to the hospital, wear a face mask and always cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze. Don't use public transport. If you don't have your own transport, the sanitary inspector can send a vehicle to pick you up. [URL]Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department|https://pacjent.gov.pl/podejrzewasz-ze-masz-koronawirusa#szpitale-z-oddzialami-zakaznymi[/URL][BR]When you're in a life or health emergency, such as shortness of breath, call an ambulance by dialling the emergency number [PHONE]999[/PHONE] or [PHONE]112[/PHONE]. Be sure to mention that you suspect being infected with coronavirus.
recommendations_text_32: If you have a mask, wear it every time someone from outside enters the room or vehicle in which you are present. Also put it on when you enter medical facilities. People around you should also wear a mask, especially if you cannot put it on yourself (e.g. when it increases breathing difficulties). [URL]See how to safely put on and take off your mask|https://pacjent.gov.pl/bez-maski-ani-rusz#Jak-zakladac-i-zdejmowac-maske[/URL]
recommendations_text_33: Strictly follow the rules of hygiene
recommendations_text_34: A few simple rules with which you can significantly reduce the risk of infecting yourself or spreading infection to others:[BR][BR]• Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum 60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with the hand washing instructions provided on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate.[BR]• Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth.[BR]• Cough or sneeze in disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend, and disinfect your hands after you sneeze.[BR]• Choose a set of mugs, cutlery and other kitchen utensils that only you will use.
recommendations_text_35: If you don't know how to proceed, call the helpline of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate Contact Centre:
recommendations_text_36: [B]Notify your loved ones with whom you have met in the last 15 days.[/B][BR][BR]If you don't know how to proceed, call the helpline of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate Contact Centre:
recommendations_text_37: [B]You are feeling very bad? Don’t wait. Contact your primary care physician or call the emergency number 112. Inform about your illness.[/B]
recommendations_text_38: Do you want to learn more?
recommendations_text_39: If you have additional questions or concerns, please go to [URL]gov.pl/koronawirus|https://www.gov.pl/koronawirus[/URL] or [URL]pacjent.gov.pl|https://www.pacjent.gov.pl[/URL], where you can chat with a consultant. You can also call the National Health Fund NFZ helpline 800 190 590.
recommendations_text_4: Call the Contact Centre of the State Sanitary Inspection. An employee of the helpline will guide you further.
recommendations_text_42: Take care of yourself and follow the rules of home quarantine.[BR][BR][B]Notify your loved ones with whom you have met in the last 15 days.[/B]
recommendations_text_6: Monitor your health regularly, take your temperature twice a day and record it in your Health Diary.
recommendations_text_7: [B]If your symptoms seem disturbing, contact your primary care physician.[/B]
recommendations_text_9: During quarantine, you must stay at home, at the address you indicate. You cannot change the quarantine location. If you can't quarantine at home, you can do it in an indicated facility.
regulations_content_text10: [B]GIS[/B] - it is understood as the Chief Sanitary Inspector based in Warsaw, at ul. Targowa 65, 03–729 Warsaw. GIS is the controller of personal data within the meaning of the GDPR in relation to the personal data of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users. GIS independently determines the purposes and methods of processing Personal Data within STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe;
regulations_content_text101: [B]Test PIN code[/B] - it is understood as a randomly generated alphanumeric password active for half an hour from the moment of generation, which is provided to the User by the Contact Centre consultant. The Test PIN code is provided to the User who has a high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] generated by the Analytical Module and high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] confirmed by the Triage Module;
regulations_content_text107: In the event that the Analytical Module, having analysed the Keys, indicates a high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] in connection with potential contact with a Person Tested Positive, the User will receive a proposal to check their symptoms in order to determine the possibility of being referred to a refundable RT-PCR test for the presence of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. User will check their symptoms in the Application using the Triage Module. The proposal to check the symptoms will be displayed on the main screen of the Application and will be active for the period of continuous high risk of exposure to infection. determined by the Analytical Module. If the User decides to perform a self-assessment test of the risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] using the Triage Module, and the Triage Module will show a high risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] the User will be able to call the Contact Centre in order to obtain the Test PIN Code. Prior to that, the User is informed that the verification of their Application results in notifying the Chief Sanitary Inspector about the status of high risk of exposure to infection generated by the Analytical Module and the Triage Module. After obtaining the Test PIN, the User enters it into the Application, confirms and waits for the correctness of the Test PIN to be verified. If the verification is correct, the User will be entitled to have a refundable RT-PCR test for the presence of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. Referral to a refundable RT-PCR test is obtained within further contact with a representative of the Contact Centre.
regulations_content_text108: The use of the functionality Current restrictions in poviats is voluntary. In the "Important information" panel of the Application, the user may select the "Current restrictions" tile, and then select one or more poviats in order to receive daily information about the status (yellow or red) of a given poviat. Information about the current status of restrictions is displayed on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe main screen by a circle in the colour that represents the appropriate poviat status assigned to the poviat name that is being followed by the User. In the case of updating the status of the poviat selected by the User, the Application will send a PUSH Notification, which will be displayed on the main screen of the User's Device. The Current restrictions in poviats functionality doesn't use the User's data, such as, in particular, the User's location. The User may at any time change the poviats that are being followed, as well as resign from using the functionality of Current restrictions in poviats in the appropriate Application settings.
regulations_content_text110: [B]Personal Data[/B] - it is understood as any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person within the meaning of Article 4 point1 of the GDPR. The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR, as the purpose of processing does not require identification, therefore STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users are not identified;
regulations_content_text112: [B]Processing[/B] - it is understood as an operation or a set of operations, which are performed on personal data or sets of personal data in an automated or non-automated manner, such as collecting, recording, organizing, structuring, storing, adapting or modifying, downloading, browsing, using, disclosing through sending, distributing or sharing in any other way, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction;
regulations_content_text113: At the end of the state of epidemic or the state of epidemic emergency related to SARS-CoV-2, the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application will be deactivated.
regulations_content_text118: [B]Federation Gate[/B] - it is understood as a network gateway operated by the European Commission with the use of a secure IT tool, which is used to receive, store and share a minimum set of Personal Data between internal servers of European Union Member States in order to ensure the interoperability of national mobile applications used to identify infectious contacts and share alerts. Federation Gateway enables Interoperability. Thanks to the Federation Gate, it is possible to send and receive Keys between the User and users of other mobile applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. Keys are shipped through the Federation Gateway, their retention period is 14 days;
regulations_content_text12: [B]MC[/B] - it is understood as the Minister of Digital Affairs based in Warsaw, at Aleje Ujazdowskie 1/3, 00 – 583 Warsaw. Based on an agreement, MC supports GIS in the development and maintenance of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe;
regulations_content_text120: [B]Interoperability or Warning in Europe[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows the exchange of Keys between the User and users of other mobile applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, which are supported by other Member States of the European Union and cooperate within the Federation Gate. Thanks to Interoperability, Users can receive information about potential exposure to infection in connection with potential contact with users of other mobile applications, similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe;
regulations_content_text121: Interoperability (Warning in Europe) is voluntary. Interoperability (Warning in Europe) is provided through the Federation Gate. In order to use Interoperability effectively, the appropriate consent must be given in the Application. The consent given by the User applies to sending and receiving Keys to all mobile applications similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. The consent may be withdrawn at any time, without affecting the sent and received Keys that were sent or received before the consent was withdrawn. After giving consent, the Keys are sent to applications similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. The history of encountering devices on which an application similar to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is installed will be stored in the Federation Gate for 14 days.
regulations_content_text19: [B]Triage Module[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows the User to perform a self-assessment of the risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19], based on the WHO questionnaire. Personal Data entered into the Triage Module are stored locally on the User's Device.
regulations_content_text21: [B]Health Diary Module[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe notepad-like functionality, enabling the User to record information about their health. Personal Data entered into the Health Diary Module are stored locally on the User's Device;
regulations_content_text23: [B]Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2[/B] - it is understood as MC and GIS acting jointly;
regulations_content_text27: [B]Device[/B] – it is understood as an electronic device through which the User gains access to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe (tablet, smartphone, etc.) with an active Bluetooth module, Android 5.0 or higher with access to the Google Play store or with an iOS system in a version not lower than 13.5 with access to the AppStore. The Analytical Module will work only on Devices with Android 6.0 supporting BLE technology or higher, or with an iOS version 13.5 or newer;
regulations_content_text29: [B]User[/B] – it is understood as a person with full legal capacity who, after accepting the Terms & Conditions and the Privacy Policy, uses STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe;
regulations_content_text31: [B]PIN Code[/B] - it is understood as a randomly generated alphanumeric password active for half an hour provided to the User who is a Person Tested Positive by the consultant of the Contact Centre. The PIN Code may be entered into STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in order to anonymously confirm that the Device belongs to a Person Tested Positive and initiate the process of transferring the Key to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server;
regulations_content_text34: [B]Key[/B] - it is understood as a randomly generated, periodic and alphanumeric string of characters sent to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, which contains encrypted Personal Data, initiating the process of analysis of exposure to infection [COVID-19] as part of the Analytical Module. The Key is transferred to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server after the Person Tested Positive enters the PIN Code into the Application;
regulations_content_text37: [B]Person Tested Positive[/B] - it is understood as a natural person with full legal capacity, who has been tested positive for the [COVID-19]. The Person Tested Positive does not have to be a User.
regulations_content_text40: [B]Contact Centre[/B] - it is understood as the unit providing the test result by phone [COVID-19] and transmitting the PIN Code to the Application Users and providing information related to [COVID-19]
regulations_content_text42: [B]Terms & Conditions[/B] – it is understood as this document that regulates the legal relationship between the User and the Entities referred to in § 2 paragraph 1 and 2 concluded at the moment the User submits a declaration of acceptance of the Terms & Conditions;
regulations_content_text44: [B]STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server[/B] it is understood as the cloud infrastructure maintained by the National Cloud Operator, used to transmit the Diagnostic Key to Users' Devices. Diagnostic Keys are stored on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server in an encrypted form for 14 (fourteen) days;
regulations_content_text45: [B]WHO[/B] - it is understood as the World Health Organization;
regulations_content_text48: Using the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application is free of charge and includes the Analytical Module, the Triage Module and the Health Diary Module, as well as support in the prophylaxis and prevention of infection, together with relevant information related to the pandemic [COVID-19] and a reminder of safe behaviour and daily hygiene habits. STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe enables to determine risk factors for infection, create and keep a medical history, including existing diseases and current pharmacotherapy, as well as keep a prevention diary. STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe provides Users with information and the guidelines issued by WHO and GIS, but the information provided is not a medical consultation or health service (in particular medical or pharmaceutical one).
regulations_content_text5: These Terms & Conditions (hereinafter referred to as: " [B]Terms & Conditions[/B] ") regulate the terms and conditions of using the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application (hereinafter referred to as: "STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe" or "Application").
regulations_content_text51: Using the Analytical Module is voluntary. The Analytical Module is provided with the use of Bluetooth technology and requires the activation of the Bluetooth module in the Device, as well as, for Devices with the Android operating system, enabling the system option of recording exposure [COVID-19] and granting consent for location (STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe does not use GPS data in the scope of the Bluetooth module), and for Devices with the iOS operating system: selecting the option Recording exposure to [COVID-19]. In order to effectively use the full functionality of the Analytical Module, the Application should be left running in the background. The application running in the background will scan the environment in search of Devices of other Application Users, and it will also be scanned by other Devices. The Application User's Device saves the history of encountering other Devices on which the Application is installed. This Personal Data (history of devices encountered) remains on Users' Devices for 14 days.
regulations_content_text56: After the Application User's Device receives the Key, the Analytical Module performs an analysis by comparing the Key with historical data on encountering other Devices with the installed Application stored locally on the User's Device in order to assess the risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19]. If the analysis of the likelihood of infection [COVID-19] shows a high or medium risk of exposure to infection [COVID-19] the User's status in the Application will change accordingly.
regulations_content_text57: Entering the PIN Code to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe by the User is voluntary.
regulations_content_text59: The condition for using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is that the User has an appropriate Device with up-to-date software and connected to the Internet.
regulations_content_text6: Before starting to use STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, the User should accept the Terms & Conditions by checking the appropriate checkbox. The use of the Application is discontinued when the User removes STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from the Device.
regulations_content_text60: Using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is possible without territorial restrictions.
regulations_content_text61: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are not responsible for any difficulties in using the Application resulting from failure to meet the technical requirements indicated in paragraph 1, including incorrect configuration of the Device, or resulting from problems with the Device or the User's Internet connection.
regulations_content_text63_1: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are entitled to change the functionalities of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in order to improve the quality of the Application and to change the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe interface in whole or in part. The name STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, logo, principles of operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, all its graphic elements and interface are protected by law. The software on which STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is based and the source code are provided by MC based on the GNU GPL-3.0 license, the details of which are available at: [URL]GPL-3.0|https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html[/URL]
regulations_content_text64: The liability of Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2
regulations_content_text65: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 undertake to make every effort to ensure the operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe without any disruptions, as well as to provide the most current WHO or GIS guidelines.
regulations_content_text66: The character of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is informative. Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 do not provide health services (in particular medical or pharmaceutical), are not intermediaries of the above-mentioned services, and do not carry out medical activities through STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. In connection with the above, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 shall not be liable for any consequences resulting from the User's use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in the area of health and life.
regulations_content_text69: The use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe cannot replace health services, including the need to consult a doctor or the competent sanitary and epidemiological station. If the User notices any deterioration of their health or has doubts about their health, they should immediately contact the emergency number [PHONE]112[/PHONE] in order to call an ambulance or inform the competent sanitary and epidemiological station or go to the nearest health care facility.
regulations_content_text72: If the use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is not possible, it is difficult or takes too long, and the health or well-being of the User deteriorates, the User should immediately call the emergency number [PHONE]112[/PHONE] in order to call an ambulance or inform the competent sanitary and epidemiological station or go to the nearest health care facility.
regulations_content_text73: In special cases, affecting the security or stability of the ICT system, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 have the right to temporarily cease or limit the operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe or the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionalities, without prior notification to Users. In particular, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are entitled to carry out maintenance work to restore the security and stability of the ICT system. The STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe User shall not be entitled to any claims in connection with the interruption or cessation of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe operation by the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2.
regulations_content_text74: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 also have the right to cease the operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe at any time, if such a justified request is submitted by an Internet provider or other authorised entity. Subject to the relevant provisions of law and these Terms & Conditions, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are not responsible for damages caused by malfunction of the transmission system, including hardware failures, delays and disruptions in the transmission of information.
regulations_content_text75: Conditions of cessation of use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe
regulations_content_text76: The User may cease using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with immediate effect and without indicating the reasons by removing STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from their Device.
regulations_content_text77: GIS may cease providing, supporting and updating STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with immediate effect by sending the User an appropriate statement via the Application or other available means of communication.
regulations_content_text79: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 will not be liable for failure to fulfil their obligations under these Terms & Conditions in time, whenever their fulfilment is delayed or impossible due to circumstances or events beyond the control of the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2, which prevent or significantly hinder the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 to act in accordance with the Terms & Conditions, such as, but not limited to: fire, flood, imposition of an embargo, strike, riots, inability to secure materials and infrastructure, failure or interruption of machinery, in each case for reasons beyond the control of the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2.If such a delay lasts longer than 30 (thirty) days, the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 will have the right to cease providing, supporting and updating STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with immediate effect.
regulations_content_text8: Whenever the Terms & Conditions refer to:
regulations_content_text81: Detailed rules regarding the privacy of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users and other people using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe or any form of contact are described in the Privacy Policy.
regulations_content_text83: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 reserve the right to make changes to the Terms & Conditions. The current version of the Terms & Conditions will be available in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe.
regulations_content_text84: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 inform that the installation of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe update may be necessary for the proper functioning of the Application and proper protection of the Personal Data contained in the Application.
regulations_content_text85: Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 may terminate the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe operation at any time.
regulations_content_text86: Any possible disputes, which may arise between the Entities referred to in § 2 paragraph 1 and 2, and the User shall be governed by Polish law.
regulations_content_text88: Complaints related to the functioning of the Application may be submitted electronically to the following address: [EMAIL]protego@mc.gov.pl[/EMAIL]
regulations_content_text90: [B]Analytical Module[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that enables saving, creating history and analysing the meeting of the User's Device with other Application Users' Devices. The Analytical Module is based on the Privacy-Preserving Contact Tracing API developed and made available by Google and Apple. The information generated by the Analytical Module along with the results of its work is stored locally on the Device for 14 days. Google and Apple in their documentation, which can be found here: [URL]exposurenotifications|https://www.google.com/covid19/exposurenotifications/[/URL] and [URL]exposurenotification|https://developer.apple.com/documentation/exposurenotification[/URL] ensure that they apply the highest security standards to protect Users' privacy;
regulations_content_text91: [B]STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe or Application[/B] – it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application, which includes the Analytical Module, the Triage Module and the Health Diary Module, and also supports the prophylaxis and prevention of infection, transmits important information related to the pandemic [COVID-19] and reminds about safe behaviours and daily hygiene habits;
regulations_content_text92: The Contact Centre consultant, providing information about the infection by phone [COVID-19]  the Person Tested Positive, will ask if such person is a STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe User. If the Person Tested Positive is a STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe User, the Contact Centre consultant will propose to enter the PIN Code to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in order to anonymously confirm that the Device belongs to a Person Tested Positive and initiate the process of transmitting the message about exposure to infection to other Application Users (by sending the Key). Entering the PIN Code initiates the process of sending the Key to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, which then transmits the Key to Application Users' Devices.
regulations_content_text95: [B]Current restrictions in poviats[/B] - it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows you to display in the Application information about areas (poviats) covered by special safety rules introduced due to the pandemic [COVID-19] based on the relevant and current ordinance on the establishment of certain restrictions, prohibitions and limitations in connection with the state of epidemic as well as the amending regulations;
regulations_content_text97: [B]PUSH notification[/B] - it is understood as a text message sent by the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, which will be displayed on the screen of the User's Device, regardless of whether the Application is turned on or not. The content of PUSH notifications will be directly related to the development of the SARS-CoV-2 virus pandemic or the Application itself and will be determined each time by the Chief Sanitary Inspector (GIS) or the Ministry of Digital Affairs (MC);

terms_text_1: Help yourself and others.[BR]Let’s get started!
terms_text_2: It's good that you decided to install the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application.
terms_text_3: It will help you find out if there is a risk that you have been around people tested positive for COVID-19.
terms_text_4: I declare that I have read the [REG]Terms & Conditions[/REG] of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe and [PP]Privacy Policy[/PP] I accept their provisions.
terms_text_5: The data controller is the Chief Sanitary Inspector (GIS), contact address: [EMAIL]iod@gis.gov.pl[/EMAIL]. The purpose of the application is to help counteract the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic, to support the rapid exchange of information and to assess the risk of infection. You have the right to access your data, correct it, delete it, limit processing, object to processing and lodge a complaint to the supervisory authority. For more information, please consult the [PP]Privacy Policy[/PP].
triage_level_call_doctor_content: Your symptoms are not indicative of COVID-19 disease from the coronavirus, but are of concern and require medical attention. If you feel your medical condition is serious and your symptoms are worsening quickly, contact your primary care physician or go to the nearest hospital emergency department (call in advance if possible) or call an emergency number.
triage_level_isolation_ambulance_content: Immediately notify the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station by phone and report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious department. Avoid contact with other people.
triage_level_isolation_call_content: Immediately notify the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station by phone and report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious department. Avoid contact with other people.
triage_level_no_risk_content: If you come back to Poland from abroad or live with a person sent to quarantine after 31 March 2020, you will be automatically sent to quarantine (if your health condition allows it).
triage_level_quarantine_content: React if your symptoms seem disturbing. Contact your primary care physician.
triage_level_self_monitoring_content: If you come back to Poland from abroad or live with a person sent to quarantine after 31 March 2020, you will be automatically sent to quarantine (if your health condition allows it).
upload_data_popup_1: Providing data - how does it work?
upload_data_popup_2: If the laboratory test will detect your infection with [COVID-19], you will be contacted by the Contact Centre Operator. [B]Enter the PIN Code it has provided below[/B] - this will let others know that they may have been in contact with the coronavirus.[BR][BR]Don't worry, we protect your privacy.
upload_data_popup_3: How does STOP COVID - ProteGo Safe work? What are the Keys?
upload_data_popup_4: The main functionality of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is based on [B]Exposure Notification API[/B] (exposure notification module), enabling the so-called [B]Contact tracing[/B]. If the user agrees, the application uses the Bluetooth module [B]to share a randomly generated encrypted Key changed every 10 minutes[/B]. Using Bluetooth, tracing scans the environment for other devices that share similar Keys. When the contact is long enough, it saves the encrypted Device Keys. If the user is diagnosed with [COVID-19] - they may voluntarily share the Keys and anonymously warn the people with whom they had contact.

user_data_settings_text3: If you erase your data, the app will become unusable. The archive of your Health Diary will be lost, and all data will have to be re-entered.

warning_in_europe_term_text_1: I agree to share the encrypted Keys with applications that cooperate with each other to counter the [COVID-19] pandemic. I can withdraw my consent at any time in the settings of the STOP COVID – ProteGO Safe app. For details on Warning in Europe, see [PP]Privacy Policy[/PP].
warning_in_europe_text2: Thanks to the Warning in Europe feature, you can send a notification of possible exposure to coronavirus to users of applications used in other European Union Member States or receive a notification from them.[BR] [BR][B]Coronavirus knows no boundaries! Send warnings also in Europe and help counter the pandemic.[/B]
warning_in_europe_text3: Why do I need the Warning in Europe feature?
warning_in_europe_text4: Research shows that effective isolation of the infected persons and the use of exposure notification applications (such as STOP COVID – ProteGO Safe) can significantly reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus. [B]However, there is one condition – the application must be used by as many people as possible.[/B][BR][BR]Warning in Europe is a solution that allows you to detect exposure to the coronavirus even more effectively. It allows you to take care of your safety! Enable Warning in Europe to ensure the safety of others.
warning_in_europe_text5: How does Warning in Europe work?
warning_in_europe_text6: Warning in Europe allows encrypted Keys to be exchanged between applications that work together to counter the COVID-19 pandemic.[BR][BR]With this feature, if you come into contact with someone with infected with COVID-19 and using another application, STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe will send you a notification.[BR][BR]This solution, like our entire application, respects your privacy and protects your personal data. By giving consent, you don't provide information about the places you have visited or your location.
warning_in_europe_text7: Risk monitoring in Poland is active regardless of whether the Warning in Europe feature is enabled.
